trans-unit.target: %organism% facilitates the implementation of your risk management process and allows you to collaboratively manage & monitor day-to-day risk management activities within your organisation.
At least one risk map uses this framework. It cannot be deleted.
This risk number is already used
Delete risk map? This action cannot be undone.
Delete framework? This action cannot be undone.
To create a risk module, click
Changes will be reflected when saved
Create framework with these matrix settings?
Delete generic risk category? Warning : risks linked to this category will be moved to category "Other".
Error: the assessment was not saved
Input data does not comply with form requirements
Frameworks are created in 3 steps: 1/ define assessment scales, 2/ define matrixes, and 3/ elaborate a risk module.
Delete action? This action cannot be undone.
This dashboard summarises key information from a risk map.
Delete event? This action cannot be undone.
No event matching your search criteria.
Delete indicator? This action cannot be undone.
Delete line? This action cannot be undone.
Default generic risk: changes restricted to certain fields.
The default category name cannot be changed
Start date cannot exceed completion date or targeted completion date.
Risk maps not linked to an organisation

You have not yet completed the questionnaire to contribute to the risk map %cartographie%.

Please provide your answers by clicking on this link

Best Regards,

%organism%
Delete risk? This action cannot be undone.

This module allows you to elaborate and circulate a risk identification questionnaire. It comprises:
- a table listing all users asked to participate ("contributors"),
- a page to elaborate a questionnaire.
Delete question? This action will also delete all answers.

trans-unit.resname: The CSRF token is invalid. Please try to resubmit the form.
trans-unit.source: The CSRF token is invalid. Please try to resubmit the form.
trans-unit.target: Request timeout Please try resubmitting the form
This default category cannot be deleted.
This default generic risk cannot be deleted.

Hello,

The questionnaire for the risk map %cartographie% has been updated. Please review / change your answers on this link..

Best Regards,

%organism%
An archived risk cannot be edited.
An archived risk cannot be deleted.
Matrixes have to be fully defined.
Please answer to the questions below. You may add or remove lines as needed. You may also attach documents in support or your inputs. Please save your changes before leaving this page.
Key Risk Indicator"%indic_name%" was successfully added.
This contributor has not provided answers to the questionnaire.
CThis contributor has not provided answers to this question.
This contributor has not provided answers for all questions. Send reminder?
The password must be 8 characters minimum and include at least one lower case letter, one upper case letter, one number and one special character.
This page provides an overall view of all %organism% users within your organisation. You can add, delete or edit account, managing user roles in risk maps.
The message could not be sent due to errors in the form.
Delete user? This action cannot be undone.
New generic risk category for framework:
New risk category for risk map:
Create a new risk map, view & manage existing risk maps.
Key Risk Indicator "%indic_name%" was successfully updated
New Key Risk Indicator for risk:

Bonjour,
Vous êtes maintenant habilité à contribuer et gérer les plans d'actions attribués par votre administrateur.

Vos codes d'accès seront envoyés dans un autre mail.

Cordialement,
This risk map has no risk to assess
Remove all roles for this risk map? This action cannot be undone.

Hello,
Your password has been updated.

You may now connect to %organism% using the following credentials:

  • Username: %login%
  • Password: %password%

Best Regards,

Hello,
Below are your credentials to connect to %organism%:

  • Username: %login%
  • Password: %password%

Best Regards,
This user is no longer pre-assessor for this risk.
Remove pre-assessment role from this user?
The pre-assessor role has been added to this user. Please save changes before leaving this page.
User removed from pre-assessors of the risk map
The archiving of risk "%risque_nom%" will be effective at the next validation.
The following risks have incomplete assessments (please check criticality of prioritisation matrixes)

Your are about to validate the risk map %carto_nom%
Your search has returned no results. Create action owner?

Contributor role assigned to user. Please save your changes before leaving this page.
Thank you for completing this questionnaire. Your may change your answers until the specified deadline.

This pre-assessment is incomplete. Leave page?
No role added for this risk map
Please select a risk to be assigned to this role
Please select an action plan to be assigned to this role
Consolidate risk maps based on a common framework to produce summary dashboards by organisation, or by generic risk.
No risk map selected for consolidation.
Please select risk maps to consolidate

This module provides an in-depth, cross-organisational view on the information related to a given generic risk: which organisations used it, how it was assessed ('Risks' tab), what are the indicators tracked ('Key Risk Indicators' tab), which actions have been taken ('Actions' tab). From here you can capitalise on this information by editing the generic risk, or creating a new one.
Risk to be archived|Risks to be archived
Warning: risk owners and action responsibles will no longer be able to access information on their risk(s) or action(s).
Send e-mail to inform risk owners and action responsibles?

Hello
Following the latest validation, your risk or action has been removed from the risk map and is no longer active.
%organism%

Hello
The risk of which you are owner has been validated and maintained in the risk map.
%organism%
Vous ne pouvez pas consolider des cartographies de différents référentiels.
You do not have sufficient rights to view this information.

Hello %username%,

Click on the following link to reset your password:
%confirmationUrl%

Best Regards,
Create & edit user profiles, including details, password, roles in relation to one or several risk maps.
View existing or create new frameworks. Define assessment scales, matrix layouts, and elaborate a risk module.
View or edit assessment scales to be used to prioritise risks.
Edit risk assessment criteria, criticality and assessment levels.
View or edit matrixes used for risk prioritisation.
Edit matrixes, re-assign axis and criticality / priority levels.
View or edit generic risks allowing cross-organisational consolidated analyses.

View or edit generic risk categories and generic risks allowing cross-organisational consolidated analyses. Note: the 'Other' category and the generic risk 'Other risk' are default values and cannot be deleted.

First step: determine the number (up to 4), criteria and descriptions of risk assessment scales. Note: the first two scales are assigned to criticality assessment, the third to priority assessment. The fourth scale will allow to assess (for instance) risk trend.
View assessment scales. You may now proceed to define matrixes and a risk module.
Step 2: define criticality and priority matrixes.
%organism% allows implementing, facilitating and contributing to a risk management process. It supports a collaborative, real-time monitoring of your organisation's risks.

This page is your gateway to %organism% functionalities and your risk management data. From here, you can: - Managing users (admins only) - Track changes made by users (admins only) - Look up & log risk events - View & manage risk maps (admins only) - Access a questionnaire to contribute to a risk identification campaign ('Contribution') - Access a pre-assessment form to provide your risk assessment ('Pre-assessment') - For risk owners, manage one or several risk(s) and associated action plan(s) - For action responsibles, manage one or several action(s)
The red badges with a number indicates changes made by users since your last login (the number on the badge being the number of changes logged) . Click on the badges to view the details of these changes.
Click on column titles to apply ascending / descending sorts. Use the search box at the top right of the table to search the user database.
Click on the magnifier or pencil icon to respectively view or edit an existing framework. Click on the bin icon to delete a framework (if and only if no risk map is based on it).
Click on the "Edit scales" button to change assessment scales. Use the "Matrixes" and "Risk Module" tabs to navigate in the framework.

Changes will be restricted if at least one risk map is based on the framework. You will not be able to change the number of assessment levels. If no risk map is based on the framework, you will be able to change scales using the same functionnalities as those used to create them. Please make sure you save your changes before leaving the page.

Enter text to name and describe assessment criteria and levels. You can add assessment criteria descriptions by clicking on the 'Add line' button. You will have to define criticality and priority levels to be assigned to matrixes.
Click on the 'Edit matrixes' button to define zones by assigning criticality or priority levels to each cell.
Cliquez sur le bouton "modifier les matrices" pour en changer les axes et l'allocation des niveaux de criticité / priorité. Make sure you save your changes before leaving the page.

For each matrix, define horizontal and vertical axis and assign criticality / priority levels to each cell. Make sure you save your changes before leaving the page. Once both matrixes are defined, you will be able to elaborate a risk module.
This table lists the generic risk categories of the risk module. Click on the pencil icon to rename or change the colour of a category. Click on the bin icon to delete a category.

This table lists all generic risks. When creating a generic risk, you can fill out a descriptive sheet to help users documenting their risks, and capitalise on the information from previous risk maps. You may also import a risk module, provided you use a file with a valid format - click on the 'import risk module' button to download a template. Click on the pencil icon to view & edit generic risk sheets. Click on column titles to apply ascending / descending sorts. Click on the bar charts icon to consolidate and view all risks in the database (with their associatd Key Risk Indicators and actions) linked to a generic risk.

Click on the 'add role' button to assign one or several roles to a user for a given risk map. Click on "add risk map" and repeat the same step if the user participates to more than one risk map. Make sure you save your changes before leaving this page.
You may edit your settings by clicking 'Edit assessment scales'. Use the links to view the matrixes of the risk module.

This table lists all risk maps. Clicking on the title of a risk map or the magnifier icon will open the corresponding risk map dashboard page. Click on the pencil icon to edit the name of a risk map. Click on the bin icon to delete a risk map.
You can apply ascending or descending sorts by clicking on any column title. You can also perform quick searches using the search box at the right above the table.

This dashboard provides a real-time summary of the risk map, including risk status, Key Risk Indicator outlook, action plan progress, risk events and log entries. Click on a risk title to access the corresponding risk monitoring page. From this page you can also directly create a new risk or initiate a validation using the buttons at the top right of the page.
You can apply ascending or descending sorts by clicking on any column title. You can also perform quick searches using the search box at the right above the table.

Use the "Members", "Assessment Scales" and "Risk Categories" tabs at the top of the page to navigate between the 3 components of the risk map admin module. Further instructions are provided in the Help section of each of those pages.
The risk map admin module provides all required functionalities to prepare and manage your risk map, from customisation to user roles.

This table lists all users participating to the risk map, i.e. being assign the role(s) of contributor, pre-assessor, risk owner, and/or action responsible. From this page, you can add new members of change the role(s) of existing members. You can communicate with members using the built-in e-mail functionality.

Use the search box above the table to quickly find users in the database. Clicking the "Add member" button at the top right of the page will open a user profile screen in which you will be asked to enter information (user details, role(s) in the risk map).
Click on the pencil icon to access & edit user profiles. Click on the bin icon to remove all roles from a member, which effectively results in removing the user from the risk map members list. Clicking on the envelope icon allows you to send e-mails. If you tick the box below the envelope icon above the table, the e-mail will be sent to all members.
View and manage the assessment scales used for the risk map.
This page displays the assessment scales as defined in the framework. You can customise scales by changing assessment criteria description (adding, removing or editing).
Adapt risk assessment scales for your risk map.
You can edit criteria descriptions, add or delete descriptions ("Add line" button or bin icon).
You can edit of create risk categories to classify risks by risk areas.

You can import risk categories from the framework on which you risk map is based by clicking on the "import from framework" button. You can also edit categories (title, assigned colour) by clicking on the pencil icon in the table. Click on the bin icon to delete a category.
View details of changes made by users since your last login.

Use the date fields above the table to specify a period. Use the search box to search objects (e.g. risks, actions, indicators...), risk maps, users. Click on column titles to apply ascending/descending sorts.
Define an organisational structure to which risk maps will be linked.

You can re-assign risk maps within your organisation by simply drag-and-dropping a risk map to its new position. Clicking on the pencil icon next to each organisation will allow you change its name as well as parent-child relationships.
The map displayed on this page allows you to track in real-time all risk events logged and shared by all users.
You can log a risk event from this page. Events are geolocalised and linked to a framework, a generic risk, or a risk map.Search the risk event database by using the filters.

Consolidate risk maps based on a common framework to produce summary dashboards. Consolidation is either organisation-based (e.g. all business divisions risk maps of a group) or cross-organisational, based on generic risks (e.g. giving a view of what various organisations have reported in relation to a the generic risk 'major business interruption').
Select risk maps (making sure all are based on the same framework) and click the 'consolidate' button.

Category;#;Generic risks;Description;Causes;Key words;Generic risk mitigation measures;KRI Operational risks;1;Defective product design;Products in the field have to be recalled due to flawed design;Product development gating process failure, Inadequate QA;Project committee, validation, capex;QA audits every 5 years;go-to-market average time Financial risks;2;Credit risk;Accounts receivable significantly increase or cannot be recovered;Political situation, regional/global downturn...;COFACE, payment terms,...;LoC, political risks insurance coverage, region-specific payment terms...;accounts receivable, overdues...
The pre-assessor role could not be assigned to this user as the risk map has no risks.
Delete organisation? Warning: all child organisations will also be deleted. Risk maps and users will no longer be associated to an organisation.

This table lists all users asked to fill out a questionnaire ("contributors"), usually used for risk identification. It also allows tracking progress and sending reminders. Click on the envelope icon to send a reminder. Clicking on the envelope icon above the table will select all contributors. Click on the magnifier icon to view completed questionnaires. Click on the pencil icon to view/ edit user profiles and manage roles in relation to the risk map. You can remove the contributor role from a user by clicking on the bin icon.
Click on column title to apply ascending / descending sorts. Use the search box to search contributors.

This module allows building a questionnaire. Enter instructions in the text field at the top of the page, such as for instance the definition of "risk" for your organisation. You may attach files to the questionnaire to provide further information to contributors by clicking on the "Browse" button.
Click on the "Add question" button to add as many questions as required. For each question, you will be asked to specify the number of answers. Once questions are added, they can be edited (pencil icon) or deleted (bin icon).
This module allows you to manage the risk register by adding, documenting or editing risks and descriptive sheets.

Clicking the 'Add risk' button will open a risk sheet to be filled out.
In the risk register table, click on a risk title or the magnifier icon to view/edit a risk sheet. Click on the user icon to assign risk owners.
Click on the drawer icon to archive a risk - this change will be effective when the risk map is validated.
Before the first validation of a risk map, risks can be deleted by clicking on the bin icon.

A risk sheet comprises the following fields:
- Risk number: a number is automatically proposed and can be changed before the first validation of the risk map. It will be a unique, definitive risk ID afterwards. - Risk title: the name of the risk (required field) - Label: used to plot risks in matrixes, 10 characters maximum (required field) - Category: risk area the risk is associated with, defined in the risk map admin module - Generic risk: generic risk (from the risk module of the framework the risk map is based on) the risk is linked to. Selecting a generic risk from the drop-down menu will open a pop-in window allowing to import generic descriptions to your risk sheet. By default, all generic description fields are selected. Untick to deselect as required and click on the 'import' button at the bottom of the pop-window. You can import generic information at any time by re-selecting the generic risk. Imported data will be added to existing information in the risk sheet and highlighted in red. - RSS feed: copy/paste a valid RSS link to update the risk sheet in real-time with information from the RSS source, e.g. a key word-based news search, or links from a news website. - Attached documents: click on the clip icon at top right of the page to upload files to the risk sheet. Uploaded documents will appear below the 'Attached documents' label. To manage/delete attached document, click on the clip icon. - Categorization : Categorization are composed with different items to mark. These categorization are used to classify your risk with predefined category.
The 3 tabs in the top middle of the page allow navigating in the various sections of the Risks module. Click on "Risk Monitoring" to view a dashboard-style page tracking all key information for a given risk. Click on "Action plan" to view / manage the mitigating actions related to the risk. Click on "Key Risk Indicators" to view / manage indicators used to monitor the risk.
View all risks of the risk map classified by risk areas.
Click on risk titles to view/edit descriptive sheets.
Archived risks are removed from the risk map and kept with their assessments, actions, and Key Risk Indicators. They can be restored if needed.

Click on the magnifier icon to view the risk sheet, actions, and Key Risk Indicators of archived risks.
Click on the inverted arrow to restore a risk in the risk map with its assessments, actions and Key Risk Indicators. You will be able to edit its position (risk number) in the risk register if needed.

This page displays a dashboard-style summary of all information for a given risk: - In the top left section of the page are the risk title (click on the pencil icon to edit the risk sheet), as well as Key Risk Indicators values and general outlook - In the top right section of the page are risk owner(s), risk status, and current validated assessment - In the page body are the descriptive risk sheet, and drop-down fields to the right allowing to propose a new assessment (these fields appear with the first validation of the risk map). Also to the right are a summary of mitigating actions, as well as the RSS feed and events logged for the risk. The "View previous version" button displays the risk sheet as it was at the previous validation.
In the descriptive sheet, clicking on the bar charts icon next to the "Generic risk" field will open the consolidation module, allowing you to view other risks documented by other organisations linked to the same generic risk.
Click on the "Action plan" or "Key Risk Indicators" tabs at the top of the page to respectively view mitigating actions and tracking indicators for the risk.

This section allows you to elaborate and follow up on an action plan.
An action plan comprises several actions, all listed on this page. Clicking on the 'Add action' button will open a descriptive sheet to be filled out. You will be asked to specify a title, a start date, a targeted completion date (which can be changed afterwards), and a category (if you wish to group actions by categories). Once an action is created, it will appear in the summary table below the "Comments" field.
The summary table provides an overview of the actions and their progress.
Click on the user icon to assign action responsibles (note: you will be asked to enter the user's e-mail. The system will search for this user in the database and propose matches if any. If no match is found, you will be proposed to create a new user for whom the action responsible role will be automatically set. The user will be informed by e-mail).
Click on the pencil icon to edit the action title, start / targeted completion / completion dates.
Click on an action title of the magnifier icon to open the action sheet.
Click on the bin icon to delete an action.
Information pertaining to the action plan as whole is positioned in the upper section of the page, above the summary table: - the "Priority" field is a reminder of the risk's priority level as per its assessment - the "Progress" field allows reporting the overall progress of the action plan (considering the progress of all actions) - the "Outlook" field allows reporting the situation of the action plan as a whole: are actions by and large in line with their targeted completion dates? Are some actions delayed? Should an alert be escalated to inform of the difficulties experienced for one or several actions? - the "Comments" field allows keeping track of any useful information on the elaboration, implementation and follow-up of the action plan.
At the top of the page, click on the pencil icon next to the risk title to edit its descriptive sheet.

In the upper section of the page are: - a reminder of the risk to which the action applies - the title of the action (can be edited by clicking on the pencil icon) - the category of the action as defined by the risk owner - the responsible(s) of the action - the start date (click on the date to edit) - the targeted completion date (click on the date to edit) - the completion date (click on "" or the date to edit)
In the middle section of the screen are: - a description field, e.g. to detail the objective and implementation details of the action - a comment field, to keep track on any useful information on the action, e.g. difficulties experienced - to the right of these two fields, "Action progress" allows reporting the progress of the action as a percentage (click on a percentage value to change progress) ; "Outlook" indicates the status of the action ; "Recurring action" allows specifying whether the action is one-off or recurring over time. Finally, under the "Attached documents" label are all files uploaded to further document the action. To upload a file, click on the clip icon at the top right of the page.
In the lower section of the page are the action Key Performance Indicators (KPIs). There are two types of KPIs: - quantitative KPIs allow to objectively track action progress. For these KPIs, you will be asked to specify a unit (e.g. "%", or "d" for number of days) - qualitative KPIs to which a date can be assigned, consisting in milestones and/or individual tasks to be performed to carry out the action. Once KPIs are created, you will be able to add values with an outlook (quantitative KPIs) by clicking on the "+" icon. you may also edit KPIs (name, type, unit, date, values, outlook) by clicking on the pencil icon. To delete a KPI, click on the bin icon. Use the "To do/Done" toggle to indicate when a milestones is cleared and/or a task is completed / closed (qualitative KPIs)

Key Risk Indicators (KRI) allow to track and anticipate changes in risk exposure. Clicking on the "Add KRI" button will open a window in which you will be asked to specify the title of the indicator as well as its unit (e.g "%", or "d" for a number of days). Once created, the indicator will appear in the table below the 'Comments' field.
Click on the "+" icon in the table to add values to a KRI. Click on the pencil icon to edit a KRI (title, unit, date, values, outlook). Click on the bin icon to delete an indicator.
In the upper section of the page, the "KRI outlook" drop-down field allows reporting the overall outlook of the indicator. The "Comments" field allows keeping track of any useful information on the indicator.
At the top of the page, click on the pencil icon next to the risk title to edit its descriptive sheet.
This page allows managing a pre-assessment campaign.

When adding a pre-assessor, you will be asked to enter the user's e-mail. The system will search for this user in the database and propose matches if any. If no match is found, you will be proposed to create a new user for whom the pre-assessor role will be automatically set. The user will be informed by e-mail. Click on the pencil icon to change selected risks submitted for pre-assessment ot a given user. You will be directed to the user profile. From here, click on the bin icons next to risk title in the roles section to remove risks from the scope of pre-assessment.
Once the pre-assessment campaign is in progress, the summary table on this page indicates the progress of each pre-assessor as a percentage value. Click on the magnifier icon to view pre-assessments. Clicking on the envelope icon allows you to send an e-mails to one or several pre-assessors (those with a ticked box). If you tick the box below the envelope icon above the table, the e-mail will be sent to all members. To remove the pre-assessor role from a user, click on the bin icon.
This page displays a summary of an individual pre-assessment.

Risk labels are plotted on the matrixes. Place your mouse over a label to view the full title of a risk. Below the matrixes is a table summarising all pre-assessments for each risk from the pre-assessor. Click on the pencil icon to edit a risk assessment.

Drag and drop the risk label in each of the two matrixes (click on "Prioritisation matrix" to view the second matrix). On each matrix are: - Pre-assessments, indicated by an icon if the anonymous mode is selected, or by the initials of pre-assessors if you deactivate the anonymous mode by clicking on the toggle button to the right above the matrix - The current assessment if the risk has already been assessed and validated
Below the matrix are descriptions of selected assessment values as per risk assessment scales. The "Risk owner" field allows designating one or several risk owner(s). Enter a user e-mail, name or surname and the system will search the database to return matches. If no match is found, you will be able to create a new user with the risk owner role automatically set by specifying an e-mail address. The user will be notified by e-mail. If you are unsure of risk ownership, or cannot specify an individual at this stage, use the 'Other' field, e.g. to indicate the organisation owning the risk. You will be able to specify an individual later on. Please make sure you save changes before proceeding to the next risk.
This page displays the result of the assessment phase. It allows fine-tuning risk assessments and validating the risk map.

Viewing and fine-tuning risk assessments can be done in two ways: using the "normal" mode, or the "zoom" mode, by clicking on the matrix or the magnifier icon to the right above the matrix. Either way you can - Filter risks by risk category, criticality or priority level by using the drop-down menus above the matrix - Filter risk by categorization by marking interesting items - Drag and drop risks in both matrixes to change their assessments
Click on "Prioritisation matrix" to view the second matrix.
In normal mode, below the matrixes are - risks which are not yet assessed - simply drag and drop labels in both matrixes to assign assessments - risks to be archived - again, simply drag and drop labels in both matrixes to remove these risks from the archiving queue. Conversely, drag and drop a label from the matrix to the "to be archived" section to archive a risk.
Below the matrix is a summary table listing all risks of the risk map. You may designate risk owners by clicking on the user icon. Enter a user e-mail and the system will search the database to return matches. If no match is found, you will be able to create a new user with the risk owner role automatically set by specifying an e-mail address. The user will be notified by e-mail.
This summary table lists all actions documented for all risks of the risk map.

Click on the title of an action or the magnifier icon to open it. Click on the pencil icon to edit the action title, its category, start date, targeted completion date and completion date. Click on the bin icon to delete an action.
Click on column titles to apply ascending / descending sorts. Use the search box above the table to the right to search actions.

Add answers by clicking on the "+" icon below the last answer field. Click on the bin icon to delete answers.
If needed to support / illustrate your answers, you may attach up to 5 documents for each question.

Click on the next / previous buttons to navigate in the risks register. For each risk, drag and drop the cursor above the histograms representing assessment levels. The description of the selected assessment level will appear to the right.
Use the drop-down field at the top right of the page to directly access a risk.
Create user profiles and assign roles.
User %email% will be created. He or she will receive login credentials by e-mail in a few minutes.
The action %action% of which you were responsible was removed from the risk map %carto%.
Add to / delete a risk owner from risk %name%
Add to / delete responsible from action %name%
%user% will no longer be owner of the risk %name%. He or she will be informed by e-mail.
%user% will no longer be responsible of the action %name%. He or she will be informed by e-mail.
%user% is now owner of the risk %name%. He or she will be informed by e-mail.
%user% is now responsible of the action %name%. He or she will be informed by e-mail.
You have been designated owner of the risk %name% of the risk map %carto%

You have been designated owner of the risk %name% of the risk map %carto%. | You have been designated owner of the risks %name% of the risk map %carto%. | You have been designated owner of the risks %name% of the risk map %carto%.
You have been designated administrator of the risk map %carto%.
Please enter your user name and password

Hello %username%,

Your account has been locked after 3 failed login attempts. Please reset your password to unlock your account.

To reset your password please click on the following link:
%confirmationUrl%

Best Regards,
To change user password, type it twice. Note: a password must be 8 characters minimum and include at least an upper case letter, a number, and a special character.
The account %account% has been locked following 3 failed login attempts. An e-mail was sent to user to reset his or her password.
%organism%, the Risk Management platform by Arengi.
Welcome and thank you for using %organism%. Please update your profile. We advise you change you password.

Assessments for each organisation are plotted on matrixes. The summary table below the matrixes provides a dashboard view for each instance of the generic risk in each organisation. You can view assessment scales by clicking on the ladder icon. You can also directly access a risk monitoring screen within its risk map by clicking on the magnifier icon. You may contact the administrator or an organisation by clicking the envelope icon. Click on the eye icon next to the generic risk title at the top left of the page to view its descriptive sheet.

This table displays all Key Risk Indicators documented within the selected organisation in relation to the generic risk. Click on column title to apply ascending/descending sorts. Use the search box above the table to the right to search KRIs. Click on the eye icon next to the generic risk title at the top left of the page to view its descriptive sheet.

This table displays all mitigating actions documented within the selected organisation in relation to the generic risk. Click on column title to apply ascending/descending sorts. Use the search box above the table to the right to search actions. Click on the eye icon next to the generic risk title at the top left of the page to view its descriptive sheet.
This summary table displays key information of risk maps selected for the consolidation.

This summary table displays key information by generic risk across organisations. Click on the magnifier icons in the table to view a detailed consolidation for each generic risk. Click on column titles to apply ascending/descending sorts. Use the search box to search generic risks.
Pre-assessments and contribution questionnaires will be reset.
Your questionnaire is about to be saved. Will you be bringing changes later on?
Risk not yet covered by the risk module
You can't remove this generic risk because other risks are attached to it.
You have been designated responsible for the action %name% of the risk map %carto%.
At least one item in each category has to be selected
You will be disconnected in 30 minutes due to inactivity
File import failed. Unsupported / unrecognised file type.
An error occured while reading the RSS feed
Create, view & manage classifications for your risks. Each classification comprises several items.
Create a classification by clicking on the "Add classification" button

This table lists all categorisation items. To create an item, click on the "add item" button". You will be asked to fill in a name for the new item. You may also proceed by bulk upload, provided you submit an import file complying with the formatting which will be detailed when clicking on the "Import" button. Clicking on the pencil icon on each row to the right of the table will allow editing the name of an item. To delete an item, click on the bin icon.
Consolidate risk maps linked to the same Framework to generate general summary tables, cross-organisational analyses by generic risk(s) and/or classifications.

This module provides a detailed & cross-organisational view of records linked to the selected category item: which organisations use it, what their respective assessments are ('Risks' tab), which indicators are tracked ('Indicators' tab), and which actions have been taken ('Actions' tab).

Assessments from each organisation are plotted on the matrixes. Below the matrixes is a summary table of key information for each risk in each organisation. Click on the ladder icon to view assessment scales. Click on the magnifier icon to access directly the risk monitoring page of a given risk within its risk map, which will also give you access to the action plan and Key Risk Indicators. You may also contact the admin of a risk map by clicking on the enveloppe icon.To view the description of a generic risk, click on the eye icon next to its title.
This category is linked to a risk map. You have to bring changes to the risk map in question to edit classification items.

Hello,

A prospect just sent a subcription request for %organism%.

Please log in the server to create his/her environment following the steps below:

cd /path/to/arengibox.com/arengibox && php config/console arengi:customer:create

...and answer questions by filling in with the information provided by the prospect:

  • Organisation name %name%
  • Adress: %address%
  • Post code: %zipcode%
  • City: %city%
  • Country: %country% (%countryCode%)
  • Last name: %lastname%
  • First nale: %firstname%
  • E-mail: %email%
  • Telephone: %phone%
  • Position: %function%
  • Subscription plan %subscription%
  • Arengi framework import: %importReferencial%

Regards,

%organism%

This screen allows viewing, printing or exporting (Excel file) the summary of the current risk map, including the evolution of assessments compared to its previous version. You may also change the title and executive summary of a risk or access its detailed sheet by clicking on the "Title and executive summary" cell.

Risk management is carried out in accordance with ERDF's risk management and internal control policy. The effectiveness of mitigating actions is monitored as part of the management cycle and the process and performance management system (performance and management reviews).
The ambition is reflected in the time horizon chosen to reduce overall criticality to an acceptable residual level for ERDF.
